required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Peginterferon (e.g. Pegasys)-Based Direct Acting Antiviral Triple Therapy in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C Genotype 1
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional, Prospective Cohort Study of the Effectiveness, Safety and Utilization of Two Approved Pegylated Interferon-Based Direct Acting Antiviral Triple Therapies in the Management of Genotype 1 Chronic Hepatitis C in Routine Clinical Practice in the USA

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective observational study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of two approved pegylated interferon-based direct acting antiviral triple therapies in patients with chronic hepatitis C genotype 1. Patients receiving pegylated interferon (e.g. Pegasys) and ribavirin plus either telaprevir or boceprivir in accordance with local standard of care and US labeling will be followed for the duration of their treatment and for up to 24 weeks post-treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Any Reason
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to the treatment discontinuation or the date of the last dosing for participants who were ongoing or completed the study treatment (including those who shorten the treatment based on response-guided therapy)
primary_outcome.description: Time to premature treatment discontinuation for any reason (weeks) was calculated as follows: date of treatment discontinuation for any reason - first treatment administration date + 1/7. The estimated survivorship curves were obtained from Kaplan-Meier maximum likelihood estimates for each treatment group. Participants who completed the study treatment (including those who shorten the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored on their last dosing date.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) at 12 Weeks or Later After Completion of the Treatment Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks or later post-completion of the treatment period
primary_outcome.description: SVR rate defined as the number of participants with undetectable HCV RNA (i.e., HCV RNA less than 50 IU/mL) at 12 weeks or later post-completion of the treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Virologic Response (VR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, and 48; and 12 weeks post-completion of treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: VR was defined as undetectable HCV RNA (i.e.,HCV RNA less than 50 IU/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With VR by Categories of Very Rapid VR (VRVR), Rapid Virological Response (RVR), VR Week 8, Early Virological Response (cEVR), Partial Virological Response (pEVR), and None of the Above
secondary_outcome.description: VRVR was defined as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at treatment Week 2; RVR as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL by treatment Week 4, but no HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at Week 2; Week 8 VR as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL by study Week 8 but no HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at Weeks 2 to 4; cEVR as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL by treatment Week 12 but no HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at Weeks 2 to 8; and pEVR as at least a 2 log10 decrease in HCV RNA by treatment Week 12 but no HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at Weeks 2 to 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Extended VR, Virologic Breakthrough/Rebound, Virologic Relapse, and Who Were Non-responder
secondary_outcome.description: The extended VR is defined as initial HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL during Weeks 2 to 24 and remaining HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at all subsequent assessments; virologic breakthrough/rebound is defined as detectable HCV RNA during the treatment period in participants with prior non-detectable HCV RNA or increase of HCV RNA by >=1 log10 above nadir for direct-acting antiviral (DAA) tripe therapies (PegIFN + RBV + TEL or PegIFN + RBV + BOC); virologic relapse is defined as detectable HCV RNA during the treatment-free follow-up period in participants with HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at EoT; non-responder is defined as participants who never achieved undetectable HCV-RNA during the 48 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictors of Sustained Virologic Response by Week
secondary_outcome.description: SVR rate defined as the number of participants with undetectable HCV RNA (i.e., HCV RNA less than 50 IU/mL) at 12 weeks or later post-completion of the treatment period. The predictors defined as participants with virological response (HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at any visit), or with virological response at Week 12 (HCV-RNA < 50 IU/mL or unquantifiable or HCV-RNA >=2 log10 drop from baseline). Positive predictive value is the probability that participants with a positive screening test truly have the disease. Negative predictive value is the probability that participants with a negative screening test truly don't have the disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With SVR by Subgroups (Demographic and Baseline Factors)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants for VR to prior therapy (PegIFN + RBV) were categorized as: relapse (who completed the previous treatment with HCV RNA undetectable, but relapsed with detectable HCV RNA once treatment was discontinued), breakthrough (HCV RNA undetectable, followed by detectable HCV RNA during on-treatment period), null responder (completed at least 12 weeks of treatment with HCV RNA decrease < 2 log10 at Week 12), partial responder (HCV RNA decrease > 2 log10 by Week 12 of treatment and HCV RNA remained detectable), unknown response (completed previous treatment, but treatment response based on HCV RNA determinations was not available), and prior intolerant (treated previously, but discontinued due to adverse event or participant's choice prior to completion of therapy). Participants categorized into 3 genotypes (CC, CT and TT) based on single nucleotide polymorphism in the Interleukin 28B (IL28B) gene.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Viral Undetectability During Treatment for Participants With HCV RNA Undetectable During Treatment by Trial Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The undetectable HCV RNA means HCV RNA values less than 50 IU/mL. This outcome measure was calculated as the duration of participant's first date of undetectable HCV RNA and the date of the participant's last dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Lack of Efficacy
secondary_outcome.description: The participants discontinued the study treatment due to lack of efficacy of study treatment. Time to premature treatment discontinuation due to lack of efficacy (weeks) = (date of treatment discontinuation due to lack of efficacy - first treatment administration date + 1)/7. Participants who were ongoing or completed the study treatment (including those who shortened the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored at the date of their last dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Intolerance
secondary_outcome.description: The participants discontinued the study treatment due to intolerance of the study treatment. Time to premature treatment discontinuation due to intolerance (weeks) = (date of treatment discontinuation due to lack of intolerance - first treatment administration date + 1)/7. Participants who were ongoing or completed the study treatment (including those who shortened the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored at the date of their last dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Duration, as Measure of Extent of Exposure to Study Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of the first dose of the study drug up to withdrawal/study completion (up to Study Week 48)
secondary_outcome.description: Extent of exposure is defined as the duration of the treatment administered during the study. The mean duration of exposure to PegIFN alfa-2a, PegIFN alfa-2b, ribavirin, telaprevir, and boceprevir is calculated as the number of weeks between the start and end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Cumulative Dose, as Measure of Extent of Exposure to Study Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of the first dose of the study drug up to withdrawal/study completion (up to Study Week 48)
secondary_outcome.description: Extent of exposure is defined as the duration of the treatment administered during the study. The mean cumulative doses of PegIFN alfa-2a, PegIFN alfa-2b, ribavirin, telaprevir, and boceprevir were presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Dose Reduction, as Measure of Extent of Exposure to Study Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of the first dose of the study drug up to withdrawal/study completion (up to Study Week 48)
secondary_outcome.description: Extent of exposure is defined as the duration of the treatment administered during the study. Degree of dose reduction was calculated as actual exposure/target exposure × 100%. Target exposure was defined as the actual received treatment duration multiplied by the initial assigned dose. Actual exposure was defined as cumulative dose during the treatment period.

Compliance was assessed based on the number of participants who received the planned study treatment (PegIFN alfa-2a, PegIFN alfa-2b, ribavirin, telaprevir, and boceprevir) during the treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Treated With PegIFN, RBV, and TEL as Per the U.S. Label
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks (included 12 weeks of triple therapy + additional 12/36 weeks of dual therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: As per the U.S. labeling, participants with treatment-naive, prior relapse (TN-PR) and prior partial or null responder (PP/NR) received PegIFN + RBV + TEL (triple therapy) for 12 weeks; followed additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Treated With PegIFN, RBV, and BOC as Per the U.S. Label
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks (included 4 weeks of dual therapy + additional 28/36 weeks of triple therapy and/or additional dual therapy up to Week 48)
secondary_outcome.description: As per the U.S. labeling, participants with cirrhosis (C); non-cirrhotic/treatment-naïve (NC/TN); and non-cirrhotic/previous partial responders or relapsers (NC/PPR or R) received first 4 weeks of dual therapy, followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + BOC (triple therapy) and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Safety-related Dose Reductions
secondary_outcome.description: The dose reduction was done because of safety-related reasons (AEs) including alanine aminotransferase disorder, anemia, neutropenia, thrombocytopenia, and rash.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any AEs and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose, results in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, or results in a congenital anomaly/birth defect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Loss And Productivity Outcomes (WPAI)
secondary_outcome.description: WPAI-AS is a 6-question participant rated questionnaire to determine the amount of absenteeism, presenteeism, work productivity loss and daily activity impairment attributable to ankylosing spondylitis for a period of 7 days prior to each visit. It yields 4 sub-scores: work time missed (absenteeism), impairment while working (presenteeism or reduced on-the-job effectiveness), overall work impairment (work productivity loss or absenteeism plus presenteeism) and activity impairment (daily activity impairment). Each sub-scores was scaled as 0 (not affected/no impairment) to 10 (completely affected/impaired). Higher scores indicated greater impairment and less productivity.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic hepatitis C genotype 1 receiving pegylated interferon-based direct acting antiviral triple therapies in the US

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/= 18 years of age
- Chronic hepatitis C, genotype 1
- Receiving pegylated interferon-based direct acting antiviral therapy (pegylated interferon and ribavirin plus either telaprevir or boceprivir) in accordance with local standard of care and US labeling
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications per US labels

facility.name: Univ. of Alabama at Birmingham; The Kirklin Clinic
Loma Linda University Medical Center and Liver Center
Kaiser Permanente San Diego; Hepatology Research
Tampa General Hospital; Tampa General Medical Group
Mercy Medical Center; Institute For Digestive Health And Liver Disease
Saint Louis University Gastroenterology & Hepatology; Clinical Research Unit
Lourdes Medical Associates; Southern New Jersey Center for LIver Disease
Albert Einstein Medical Center; Division of Hepatology
Imtiaz Alam MD, P.A. - Private Practice
Digestive And Liver Disease Consultants, PA
University of Virginia Health System: Gastroenterology at UVA

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 672 participants were enrolled at 64 study sites in the U.S between 20 January 2012 and 8 February 2013.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of 672 participants, one was not eligible to receive triple therapy (pegylated interferon alfa [PegIFN], ribavirin [RBV], and telaprevir or boceprevir) and 17 who received only dual therapy (PegIFN + RBV) were excluded from all analyses. A total of 635 participants were included in modified all treated (mTRT) population.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received PegIFN + RBV + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.title: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Any Reason
outcome.description: Time to premature treatment discontinuation for any reason (weeks) was calculated as follows: date of treatment discontinuation for any reason – first treatment administration date + 1/7. The estimated survivorship curves were obtained from Kaplan-Meier maximum likelihood estimates for each treatment group. Participants who completed the study treatment (including those who shorten the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored on their last dosing date.
outcome.time_frame: Up to the treatment discontinuation or the date of the last dosing for participants who were ongoing or completed the study treatment (including those who shorten the treatment based on response-guided therapy)
outcome.population: modified all-treated (mTRT) population: It included all enrolled participants who had an hepatitis C Virus Ribo Nucleic Acid (HCV RNA) of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start chronic hepatitis C (CHC) therapy, received 1 triple therapy (PegIFN, RBV, and TEL or BOC), and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Any Reason
measure.description: Time to premature treatment discontinuation for any reason (weeks) was calculated as follows: date of treatment discontinuation for any reason – first treatment administration date + 1/7. The estimated survivorship curves were obtained from Kaplan-Meier maximum likelihood estimates for each treatment group. Participants who completed the study treatment (including those who shorten the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored on their last dosing date.
measure.population: modified all-treated (mTRT) population: It included all enrolled participants who had an hepatitis C Virus Ribo Nucleic Acid (HCV RNA) of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start chronic hepatitis C (CHC) therapy, received 1 triple therapy (PegIFN, RBV, and TEL or BOC), and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

measurement_list.measurement: An upper limit of CI was non-estimable due to insufficient number of participants with events.

analysis.estimate_desc: Due to the non-interventional study design, the Cox model included a propensity score as a covariate (incorporated important demographics and baseline characteristics) to account for the potential imbalance between treatment groups.
Without Propensity Score as a Covariate.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) at 12 Weeks or Later After Completion of the Treatment Period
outcome.description: SVR rate defined as the number of participants with undetectable HCV RNA (i.e., HCV RNA less than 50 IU/mL) at 12 weeks or later post-completion of the treatment period
outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks or later post-completion of the treatment period
outcome.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) at 12 Weeks or Later After Completion of the Treatment Period
measure.description: SVR rate defined as the number of participants with undetectable HCV RNA (i.e., HCV RNA less than 50 IU/mL) at 12 weeks or later post-completion of the treatment period
measure.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

analysis.estimate_desc: A multiple logistic regression model including a propensity score as a covariate (incorporated important demographics and baseline characteristics) was used for the treatment comparison.
Without Propensity Score as a Covariate

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Virologic Response (VR)
outcome.description: VR was defined as undetectable HCV RNA (i.e.,HCV RNA less than 50 IU/mL)
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, 32, 36, 40, 44, and 48; and 12 weeks post-completion of treatment period
outcome.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.description: VR was defined as undetectable HCV RNA (i.e.,HCV RNA less than 50 IU/mL)
measure.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Number of Participants With SVR by Subgroups (Demographic and Baseline Factors)
measure.description: Participants for VR to prior therapy (PegIFN + RBV) were categorized as: relapse (who completed the previous treatment with HCV RNA undetectable, but relapsed with detectable HCV RNA once treatment was discontinued), breakthrough (HCV RNA undetectable, followed by detectable HCV RNA during on-treatment period), null responder (completed at least 12 weeks of treatment with HCV RNA decrease < 2 log10 at Week 12), partial responder (HCV RNA decrease > 2 log10 by Week 12 of treatment and HCV RNA remained detectable), unknown response (completed previous treatment, but treatment response based on HCV RNA determinations was not available), and prior intolerant (treated previously, but discontinued due to adverse event or participant’s choice prior to completion of therapy). Participants categorized into 3 genotypes (CC, CT and TT) based on single nucleotide polymorphism in the Interleukin 28B (IL28B) gene.
measure.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

class.title: Ethnicity: Not Hispanic or Latino, n = 450, 128
VR to Prior Therapy: relapser, n = 64, 21
VR to Prior Therapy: breakthrough, n = 3, 2
VR to Prior Therapy: null responder, n = 62, 10
VR to Prior Therapy: partial responder, n = 29, 7
VR to Prior Therapy: unknown response, n = 21, 1
VR to Prior Therapy: prior intolerant, n = 22, 14
VR to Prior Therapy: missing, n = 291, 87

outcome.title: Duration of Viral Undetectability During Treatment for Participants With HCV RNA Undetectable During Treatment by Trial Treatment
outcome.description: The undetectable HCV RNA means HCV RNA values less than 50 IU/mL. This outcome measure was calculated as the duration of participant’s first date of undetectable HCV RNA and the date of the participant’s last dose.
outcome.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Duration of Viral Undetectability During Treatment for Participants With HCV RNA Undetectable During Treatment by Trial Treatment
measure.description: The undetectable HCV RNA means HCV RNA values less than 50 IU/mL. This outcome measure was calculated as the duration of participant’s first date of undetectable HCV RNA and the date of the participant’s last dose.
measure.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

outcome.title: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Lack of Efficacy
outcome.description: The participants discontinued the study treatment due to lack of efficacy of study treatment. Time to premature treatment discontinuation due to lack of efficacy (weeks) = (date of treatment discontinuation due to lack of efficacy - first treatment administration date + 1)/7. Participants who were ongoing or completed the study treatment (including those who shortened the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored at the date of their last dosing.
outcome.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Lack of Efficacy
measure.description: The participants discontinued the study treatment due to lack of efficacy of study treatment. Time to premature treatment discontinuation due to lack of efficacy (weeks) = (date of treatment discontinuation due to lack of efficacy - first treatment administration date + 1)/7. Participants who were ongoing or completed the study treatment (including those who shortened the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored at the date of their last dosing.
measure.population: mTRT population: It included all enrolled participants with HCV RNA of 50 IU/mL or more just prior to start CHC therapy, received 1 triple therapy, and treatment documentation was sufficient for assignment to treatment groups.

measurement_list.measurement: Median was non-estimable due to insufficient number of participants with premature treatment discontinuation.
Median was non-estimable due to insufficient number of participants with premature treatment discontinuation.

analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CI for median was computed using the method of Brookmeyer and Crowley.

outcome.title: Time to Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Intolerance

Time to premature treatment discontinuation due to intolerance (weeks) = (date of treatment discontinuation due to lack of intolerance - first treatment administration date + 1)/7. Participants who were ongoing or completed the study treatment (including those who shortened the treatment based on response-guided therapy) were censored at the date of their last dosing.

outcome.title: Treatment Duration, as Measure of Extent of Exposure to Study Medication
outcome.description: Extent of exposure is defined as the duration of the treatment administered during the study. The mean duration of exposure to PegIFN alfa-2a, PegIFN alfa-2b, ribavirin, telaprevir, and boceprevir is calculated as the number of weeks between the start and end of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of the first dose of the study drug up to withdrawal/study completion (up to Study Week 48)
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

outcome.title: Mean Cumulative Dose, as Measure of Extent of Exposure to Study Medication
outcome.description: Extent of exposure is defined as the duration of the treatment administered during the study. The mean cumulative doses of PegIFN alfa-2a, PegIFN alfa-2b, ribavirin, telaprevir, and boceprevir were presented.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of the first dose of the study drug up to withdrawal/study completion (up to Study Week 48)
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Mean Cumulative Dose, as Measure of Extent of Exposure to Study Medication
measure.description: Extent of exposure is defined as the duration of the treatment administered during the study. The mean cumulative doses of PegIFN alfa-2a, PegIFN alfa-2b, ribavirin, telaprevir, and boceprevir were presented.
measure.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

outcome.title: Percentage of Dose Reduction, as Measure of Extent of Exposure to Study Medication
outcome.description: Extent of exposure is defined as the duration of the treatment administered during the study. Degree of dose reduction was calculated as actual exposure/target exposure × 100%. Target exposure was defined as the actual received treatment duration multiplied by the initial assigned dose. Actual exposure was defined as cumulative dose during the treatment period.
outcome.time_frame: From the date of the first dose of the study drug up to withdrawal/study completion (up to Study Week 48)
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

outcome.title: Compliance of Study Treatment
outcome.description: Compliance was assessed based on the number of participants who received the planned study treatment (PegIFN alfa-2a, PegIFN alfa-2b, ribavirin, telaprevir, and boceprevir) during the treatment period.
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Treated With PegIFN, RBV, and TEL as Per the U.S. Label
outcome.description: As per the U.S. labeling, participants with treatment-naive, prior relapse (TN-PR) and prior partial or null responder (PP/NR) received PegIFN + RBV + TEL (triple therapy) for 12 weeks; followed additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks (included 12 weeks of triple therapy + additional 12/36 weeks of dual therapy)
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Number of Participants Treated With PegIFN, RBV, and TEL as Per the U.S. Label
measure.description: As per the U.S. labeling, participants with treatment-naive, prior relapse (TN-PR) and prior partial or null responder (PP/NR) received PegIFN + RBV + TEL (triple therapy) for 12 weeks; followed additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.
measure.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Treated With PegIFN, RBV, and BOC as Per the U.S. Label
outcome.description: As per the U.S. labeling, participants with cirrhosis (C); non-cirrhotic/treatment-naïve (NC/TN); and non-cirrhotic/previous partial responders or relapsers (NC/PPR or R) received first 4 weeks of dual therapy, followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + BOC (triple therapy) and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 weeks (included 4 weeks of dual therapy + additional 28/36 weeks of triple therapy and/or additional dual therapy up to Week 48)
outcome.population: The safety population was defined as all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Number of Participants Treated With PegIFN, RBV, and BOC as Per the U.S. Label
measure.description: As per the U.S. labeling, participants with cirrhosis (C); non-cirrhotic/treatment-naïve (NC/TN); and non-cirrhotic/previous partial responders or relapsers (NC/PPR or R) received first 4 weeks of dual therapy, followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + BOC (triple therapy) and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.
measure.population: The safety population was defined as all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

class.title: NC/TN, dual therapy through 48 week, n = 7
NC/PPR, dual therapy through 48 week, n = 3

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Safety-related Dose Reductions
outcome.description: The dose reduction was done because of safety-related reasons (AEs) including alanine aminotransferase disorder, anemia, neutropenia, thrombocytopenia, and rash.
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product.
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL

measure.title: Number of Participants With Premature Treatment Discontinuation Due to Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product.
measure.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Any AEs and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose, results in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, or results in a congenital anomaly/birth defect.
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. All 671 participants received at least one dose of study drug; however, 632 of these participants were included in the safety population.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Any AEs and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose, results in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in disability/incapacity, or results in a congenital anomaly/birth defect.
measure.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. All 671 participants received at least one dose of study drug; however, 632 of these participants were included in the safety population.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Loss And Productivity Outcomes (WPAI)
outcome.description: WPAI-AS is a 6-question participant rated questionnaire to determine the amount of absenteeism, presenteeism, work productivity loss and daily activity impairment attributable to ankylosing spondylitis for a period of 7 days prior to each visit. It yields 4 sub-scores: work time missed (absenteeism), impairment while working (presenteeism or reduced on-the-job effectiveness), overall work impairment (work productivity loss or absenteeism plus presenteeism) and activity impairment (daily activity impairment). Each sub-scores was scaled as 0 (not affected/no impairment) to 10 (completely affected/impaired). Higher scores indicated greater impairment and less productivity.
outcome.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + TEL
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received pegylated interferon alfa (PegIFN) + ribavirin (RBV) + telaprevir (TEL) for 12 weeks; followed by additional 12 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy) depending on viral response and prior response status.

group.title: PegIFN + RBV + BOC
group.description: As per the standard of care and U.S. labeling, participants received first 4 weeks of PegIFN + RBV (dual therapy), followed by additional 28 or 36 weeks of PegIFN + RBV + boceprevir (BOC) therapy, and/or then completed dual therapy through Week 48 depending on viral response and prior response status.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Work Loss And Productivity Outcomes (WPAI)
measure.description: WPAI-AS is a 6-question participant rated questionnaire to determine the amount of absenteeism, presenteeism, work productivity loss and daily activity impairment attributable to ankylosing spondylitis for a period of 7 days prior to each visit. It yields 4 sub-scores: work time missed (absenteeism), impairment while working (presenteeism or reduced on-the-job effectiveness), overall work impairment (work productivity loss or absenteeism plus presenteeism) and activity impairment (daily activity impairment). Each sub-scores was scaled as 0 (not affected/no impairment) to 10 (completely affected/impaired). Higher scores indicated greater impairment and less productivity.
measure.population: Safety population: It included all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study treatment (triple therapy) and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. “n” denotes number of participants who were available at the indicated time points for each arm.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
